Posts.Content: I missed chemo by a whisker but the tablets are a nightmare. I take Anastrozole and haven't slept well for weeks. I manage to get to about 2am, sometimes, and then the hot sweats kick in and the aching limbs. Every hour I am up out of bed as I am dripping. We are in the South of France at the moment, in our caravan, so no where to get up and go to. It is really hot too so that doesn't help, mind you during the day it is nice! Trying to have a cat nap during the day but not easy. Hubby has gone grape picking, we are on a vineyard, I usually go too but do not feel up to it this year. You usually come back with loads of scratches from the vines so cannot afford to have that happen. I had lymph nodes removed. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Sleepless Nights

Posts.Content: I had these type of pains on Anastrozole, I couldn't cope with the agony in my joints in my arms and legs. I was allergic to Tamoxifen but am now on Exemestane and seem to be coping better with these. If you are on one of these drugs they can be changed. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Pain in joints and muscles

Posts.Content: Hi Claire, i had a lumpectomy and sentinel node removal on the 27th April. I had to stay in overnight after the op but my blood pressure was low or I might have been discharged that night. I had to wait three very long weeks for the results, grade 3 aggressive but stage 1 caught early. Two weeks after that I saw the head of radiology and she examined the scar to make sure I was healing ok. She went through all the pros and cons of radiotherapy and told me there was a big debate over me whether I needed chemo. Grade 3 is usually chemo but because my node was clear it was RADS. We had booked a holiday so was allowed to go but normally I would have had the assessment within the next two weeks. That is where they do a CT scan and the computer assesses your breast. You are also given 3 pin prick tattoos so they can line you up on the RADS machine. The most uncomfortable part of this is having to have your arm above your head in an unnatural position for 10/15mins. 2 weeks later I started RADS and that was every day for 3 weeks. I just finished two weeks ago. At the moment I am extremely red and sore under my boob and I have a very dark nipple. Sharp, shooting pains also happen and that is normal. Look for the positive and they will get a clear margin and your lymph nodes will be clear too. Hope all this helps But different hospitals may do things differently. My Breast care nurse is useless too. Never there when I needed her. Hope this helps but keep posting and lots of people will answer you. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: timescales

Posts.Content: Like the rest of the posts it was only recently that I was diagnosed so remember that feeling vividly. I had been given the all clear from a mammogram and ultra sound. Because we were going on holiday the breast care surgeon decided to do a biopsy but nothing to worry about. The following week I was told I had grade 2 cancer. I was in complete denial and cried and cried and cried. I had a lumpectomy on the 27th April and had to wait 3 agonising weeks for the results. When they came back it had been regraded to a 3 but hadn't spread to my lymph nodes, I had only the sentinel node removed. Again I felt devastated, scared and really worried. I missed chemo by a hairs breathe and have now completed 6 of my 15 radiotherapy sessions. This isn't a walk in the park as I have a lot of pain BUT I am still here and hope, no will, make a full recovery and get on with my life and see my grandchildren grow up. Nobody is going to make you feel any less scared but I read everything I could so I was armed with as much information as possible. My husband got to be a very good at giving cuddles and seemed to know when I needed them. Try to keep busy but all the luck in the world. Big hugs Joyce
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: I had grade 3 but stage 1 cancer. Lymph nodes clear WLE. My oncologist said that 90 percent of women in my position were over treated e.g given chemo when RADS and hormone tablet would get just the same results. All the bump says grade 3 is automatically chemo but I didn't have it. I must admit, not that I wanted chemo, I have had black thoughts that I have left myself open to it coming back. We are in the hands of our specialists and I suppose we need to trust them. Good luck if you have to make that decision yourself, not an easy one. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Scared about today

Posts.Content: I had similar, it started two weeks after I had finished RADS.  I was given special dressings to stick on and leave them there. I only had to change the dressing if it became really smelly. I was bright red, weepy and itchy, it was horrendous. The leakage from the skin, cannot remember what it was called, is the body healing itself. Whatever you do don't put any cream or lotion on as this could irritate and make it worse. Cool it with an ice pack wrapped in a towel and see someone asap. Go bra less if you can too. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: After radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I have just started a course of EFT today, Emotional Freedom Therapy. I had never heard of it but the lady today assures me all this cr p in my head and all my negative thoughts she will get rid of by using this technique. I am willing to give anything a go, maybe see if it is available in your area. I am going to the cancer support unit for mine, free. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Have to be honest.....

Posts.Content: Brilliant news, congratulations. Enjoy your meal tonight and those glasses of wine. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Fantastic News!

Posts.Content: As others have said unless you have been on this road no one has the right to judge you, some will try but try and ignore them. Luckily I am retired but was a primary school teacher. There is no way I could have stood in front of a class of 30 children and given them the education they deserved. I still haven't fully got my head around what has happened to me and what I have been through, lumpectomy, RADS and now Anastrozole for 5 years. I still have sessions where I break down, I feel tired all the time,not sleeping because of the side effects of drugs doesn't help you MUST look after yourself and do what you need to do not what other people, including work, expect you to do. Everyone says to me, you look so healthy! Yes but they cannot see what is going on inside my head and body. Good luck, love Joyce
Posts.Title: When will I feel better?

Posts.Content: Sorry but I have just read this to my husband and he has said what a selfish ....... My husband has been there for every step of this horrendous journey. He came to the hospital with me when I had 15 sessions of radiotherapy. If you are not getting any emotional support from him I would be telling some girl friends so at least you have some support. I am nearly 12 months post surgery am I am still struggling emotionally. I am about to start counselling, is there any sessions near your hospital? There is a lot of support out there, ask and get anything you can. I am so sorry your husband isn't there for you, I couldn't have coped without mine. Luckily I am retired so don't have to worry about work but I am sure your husband is wrong and you are entitled to time off for your treatment. I am sure others will clarify this. Chin up and good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Husband remark to cancer

Posts.Content: I have a friend who was diagnosed with breast cancer 5 years ago. It had already spread to her bones so operation pointless. She was given 2 weeks to live, stage 5. She has had chemo, various drugs and is still here to laugh at the consolutants. Get another opinion and ask as many questions as you can, write them down before you see the oncologist. I hope you have someone by your side as you are going through all this hell. Good luck. Joyce xx
Posts.Title: Confused after unhelpful consultant appointment

Posts.Content: I  am on Anastrozole for 4 months now. I had WLE followed by RADS, lymph nodes clear. The side effects, for me, are awful. I have mega night sweats and the throbbing pain in my legs stop me walking far and sleeping ( not that I do much of that)  Letrozole is prescribed for women that havent gone through the change yet, Anastrozole for after the change But,I presume, they both do the same job. I had awful reaction to RADS too, like third degree burns for several weeks. Skin ok now though. Still get pain in boob from radiotherapy so it is not an easy ride.
Posts.Title: anastrozole versus tamoxifen

Posts.Content: I had a WLE in April last year, lymph nodes clear, but it was stage 1 but grade 3, aggressive. I had 15 sessions of RADS followed by 5 years of Anastrozole. After 2/3 months the side effects were horrendous so the specialist changed by tablets to Tamoxifen. Lucky me I developed one of the rare side effects. I had a rash and my whole body itched all the time. Drove me crazy. I tried taking Piriton, on the advice of my GP, but they had no effect. I rang my BCN and she told me to stop taking them immediately, give my body a rest for 5 weeks and then come back and see my specialist. That appointment is on the 12th January. My question is what else can I take? I am not prepared to take nothing and increase my risk of a recurrence. Has this happened to anyone else? I have tried different brands and they weren't any better. I was wondering if I asked for the original Aridex the side effects would be less. By the way I am 65 years old.
Posts.Title: Where can I go from here ?

Posts.Content: I had the radioactive dye injection before my lumpectomy. They still took out my sentinel node but luckily my cancer hadn't spread. I thought the dye was to show them where the modes were. I did have scans taken afterwards and I took the images back up to the ward for the surgeons to use before my operation. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: I would appreciate some knowledge ladies-and gents

Posts.Content: Try acupuncture, free at support group. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Megastrol

Posts.Content: My pre assessment was like everyone else has said, weight, height, bloods. They are not connected to the cancer team, they just assessments for any type of surgery. I knew before this what surgery I was going to have. I think I must be lucky because the person I see all the time is the oncologist and she is also the surgeon. She actually gave me her mobile number because I had an issue trying to contact my BCN or anyone when I developed an infection under my arm where they took out the lymph node. I eventually had to see my GP and my surgeon was so disgusted with the support I hadn't got she gave me her number. I did make a formal complaint and it was thoroughly looked into. You need to know what is happening and agree to it. Hope you can get it sorted. You certainly don't need this extra pressure. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: NO DISCUSSION

Posts.Content: Good luck for Monday. I will be thinking about you when I am laid on the table having my RD treatment!! love Joyce
Posts.Title: NO DISCUSSION

Posts.Content: I am on Exestemane and had a Dexa scan within weeks of starting to take it. I attend Bradford BRI. Waiting a whole year is ridiculous.
Posts.Title: Dexa scan

Posts.Content: It is available on prescription, I got some last week. The chemist had to ordered it but it was there within a couple of days. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Letrazole side effect

Posts.Content: I have been in Anastrozole for 3 months and I am in agony. some says I can hardly walk. My legs ache and throb, I cannot get to sleep with the pain.My hands are in constant pain. My night sweats are every hour so I am constantly tired. I am having an e Ray on my hand tomorrow as there is a large lump on a knuckle. The hospital gave me Accord brand and  I didn't seem too bad on them but the last ones I got were Teva and that's when all my troubles started. I have insisted on Accord brand again and will start taking them again tomorrow. I have every thing crossed that some of these side effects disappear! This is worse than the lumpectomy and radiotherapy and I had a really bad reaction to that, only just starting to heal. Oh isn't this fun! Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Joint pain update

Posts.Content: I was told grade 2 after the biopsy results but after the operation it was regarded to a 3 as the lump was bigger and there were more cancerous cells around it. Got away with not having a MX and chemo, just! As my lymph nodes were clea. Love Joyce p.s. That was Leeds Oncology hospital, St James
Posts.Title: My mum has just been diagnosed too

Posts.Content: I developed a rash with Tamoxifen, couldn't tolerate Anastrozole, joint pain etc, I couldn't walk and used to cry wth the pain. I am now on Exemestane and life is so much better. Ask there are other alternatives. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: problem with everything

Posts.Content: Not a lot of encouragement here ladies. I just finished Rads 10 days ago and am obviously still getting the sharp, shooting pains. I was hoping it would lessen over time not get worse or stay at this level of pain. Oh well as long as that big C has gone we will cope. Other ladies on this web site are going through hell and back so I consider myself very lucky I only had the lump and nodes removed. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Tender still after a year .

Posts.Content: Great news but do keep checking! Mammograms aren't infallible! Live Joyce
Posts.Title: 1st Mammogram

Posts.Content: As all the other ladies have said try and stay busy. Going back to work will help but don't do this on your own, you need friends.please take so one with you when you get the results as you will here the cancer word, if it is confirmed, and not really hear whatever else is said. I was told mine was a fatty tissue so not to worry. After the biopsies I was told it was cancer, a week wait for the results, so I didn't hear anything else. I think if you do need surgery you will have to have someone at home with you for at least 24hours or they won't discharge you. Good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Waiting for diagnosis

Posts.Content: I had grade 3, stage 1 cancer. I was told as my lymph nodes were clear it would be over treatment to have chem or a mastectomy. I had the lump removed and I have just finished 15 sessions of radiotherapy and am on Anastrozole for 5 years. Reading some of the posts on here it seems to be a post code lottery as to what treatment you get. Why would you want to go through chemo if you don't need it? I am grateful that my consultant is forward thinking and doesn't believe in whipping the boob off and pumping nasty chemicals into you if it is not necessary. Good luck with your decision. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Chemo - Should I have it or not?

Posts.Content: I am glad I didn't have that decision to make but do your research and whatever decision you come to it has to be right for you, no regrets down the line. It sounds like they couldn't just remove a lump with you so that is why the MX. I must admit I would have been fighting to keep my boob as well but I want to live for as long as possible. Radiotherapy and drugs are preventative and I am really suffering with the after effects of RADS, it is like 3rd degree burns in an area the size of a saucer BUT I want to give myself as much chance as possible to prevent this horrible disease from coming back so I went with it and just accepted the surgeons suggestions. Lots of hugs for your difficult decision. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Chemo - Should I have it or not?

Posts.Content: I am as confused as you. I had stage 1 grade 3  invasive cancer. I had a lumpectomy, lymph nodes clear and just finished radiotherapy. I am taking Anastrozole for 5 years. I was told I was border line chemo but a mastectomy was never on the cards, thankgoodness. I think it is a post code lottery and I thank God I had the right post code. Good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Very confused tonight!

Posts.Content: Big hugs I am hoping I have had enough crap thrown at me so my hubby is safe. Keep strong.
Posts.Title: Here we go again.

Posts.Content: Have you heard of Resue? It is a homeopathy liquid that you put 4 drops on your tongue before a stressful situation.and it helps to calm you. You can buy it at Boots or other chemists. Maybe worth a try, it worked for me. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Impending op and high BP.

Posts.Content: I had a clear mammogram but I found a lump. Lumpectomy, 1 lymph node removed (clear) followed by 3 weeks of radiotherapy. All very scary time and the waiting for results is awful and very stressful BUT you can do this. Keep coming on here for support. Good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: New diagnosis

Posts.Content: Good luck with all that you have to face in the next few months. Only think short term and try to deal with what is happening now. You have faith and an inner strength that you didn't know you possessed. I am through my operation and treatment so am now trying to cope with the emotional side but am getting there. Don't forget there are lots of people, organisations out there that can support you, grab what you can. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Two horrible weeks and parents are such a blessing

Posts.Content: I was put on Anastrozole first. The side effects were horrendous for me, joint pains that made me cry. I couldn't walk,sleep - awful. My specialist then put me on Tamoxifen. Very rare but I developed a rash that covered my body and I was making my skin bleed with the scratching. I am now on Exemestane and seem to be doing ok although I am getting a lot of headaches but hopefully these will ease. The hot flushes have been there with all of them and I am going to look into having acupuncture to help with this. I think Letrozole is stronger than Anastrozole so given to women who are stage 2/3/4/5, Tamoxifen is usually given to women pre menopause but also an alternative for post meno women, Exemestane is a different type of inhibitors and   doesn't seemed to be used as much as the others. I am glad, at least mentally, that I can tolerate this one as there was no other choice for me. It was this or leave to chance! Oh my drug is made in Italy too but from an English company. Some are made in India, China etc and it is the additives they out in that causes some of the awful side effects, all down to money! If you get one you can tolerate insist on that brand. Good luck Joyce
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: at last my skinniest arming to heal after my horrendous reaction to the radiotherapy. It has taken 3 long weeks to stop feeling like third degree burns. Overnight it has started to go brown, only in the middle at moment, the edges are still very red and inflamed. My skin is so rough and dry and comes away in handfuls. I have started putting Doublebase Gel on in to try and help it heal. I hope I don't get a reaction to that and take a step backwards. I am sick of ringing the hospital or doctor so just taken the advise of good ladies on here. Also these Anastrozole tablets. These achy joints are really kicking in put it seems to be every other day. I suppose I should be grateful it is not every day!! Real fun ride this cancer lark isn't it? We are going away for a few days to Scarborough, family party and bbq, so that should be something different. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Peeling like a snake!!

Posts.Content: I had 3 weeks of RADS and there was no way I could have worked whilst having treatment. Luckily it wasn't a problem for me as I am retired. I was tired after the first few sessions and also developed sharp shooting pains and a lot of 'burning'. People react differently but if you haven't got the pressure to work I would say give yourself time to heal and recover. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: How many people worked through RT? Is it doable ?

Posts.Content: I didn't have a MX so cannot know how you feel but I would probably have felt just the same. Even though that part of your body was trying to kill you it was still part of your body that is no longer there. Try to be kind to yourself and cry, scream the place down, whatever. I am in full admiration with the women on here that have been through your operation and I am sure someone will post you a reply that have been through it. Good luck and I hope the mental pain eases soon. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Tearful

Posts.Content: my tumour wasn't detected by mammogram either. I had just had the letter giving me the all clear on the 3 yearly mammogram when I found a lump, 2 weeks later. Biopsy confirmed cancerous. I was given another mammogram and it still didn't show up when they knew exactly where the lump was. I was very angry! I have just had my first yearly check up mammogram. Wonder why I am not confident when I get results. I am going to ask for a CT or ultra sound so I can try and not worry for the next year. Never ending isn't it BUT life is for living so try and do that. Easier said than done  and I still have wobble days but trying. Good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: how can you not detect a 30 mm tumour!

Posts.Content: I know someone who had this scenario She eventually had a bone marrow biopsy and they found breast cancer cells do knew that must be the primary source. She has cancer in her bones as a secondary cancer. Eventually they found 1 breast cancer cell just in front of her breast bone. She was told it was environmental breast cancer, very rare, and was caused by exposure to pesticides in her youth. She had a needle put behind her breast, she is very small  AA cup, and they found the cell. No mammogram or ultra sound would ever have shown it up. The cancer had already spread with her so no op but she did have 18 weeks of chemo. She is now on a super drug, cannot remember name but NICE have withdrawn it because of cost, and she is still here 4 years later.  Maybe nothing like you but another story. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Number 4 over with today. I have had to take a pain killer as these shooting pains in my boob is really not very nice. No sunburn yet and I have very pale skin. I have felt very lethargic today but maybe I am just having an off day.  Sorry Kat I didn't have a CT scan before treatment although you don't mean at the assessment appointment do you? If you do then yes that is when they take images to know exactly where to zap you. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi kathy, I hope everything goes ok tomorrow and you manage to get some sleep tonight. Just close your eyes and think nice thoughts like laying topless on a sunny beach!! Mind you, you will be topless, at least one if your boobs, and you may get a suntan hope this makes you smile, good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I have done WW before and after treatment but I didn't have chemo, 15 sessions of RADS. L I ke someone else said once you gave had your tattoos done they like you to stay at the same weight as your dosage is worked out on your weight and size at that time. WW is a healthy eating plan, they started a new plan in January that works on lowering sugar and saturated fat in your diet. They also have a no point healthy eating plan that you can eat as much as you want as long as it is on the specific list good luck whatever you decide to do. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Slimming world/ weightwatchers while on Chemo??

Posts.Content: Nearly half way through do time is passing reasonably quickly. I am waiting for the pain to kick in but so far I am ok. I have got my prescription and it is Colecalciferol 400 unit/ calcium carbonate 1.25 chewable tablets. I have ordered them, on line, so it will be a few days before I can pick them up. None of that nasty tablet we were talking about last week. I gave made 2 batches of scones this afternoon. One lot with strawberry pieces and the other batch with sultanas. We had to have a taste to make sure they were up to scratch!! I am going to be so fat by the time I have finished all this as I am eating everything and anything and normally I am very, very careful. Hope everyone else has hot on ok today. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I am not really pink or tingly. Today I gave a deep throb but not painful like it was last week. I hope it doesn't start again after a few more sessions. I am getting a lot of ache in my shoulders. Don't know if it because I have been baking or it is the Anastrozole. It is a matter of taking your pic on what is causing aches and pains. Glad you are still ok. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I am back from hospital too. Most of my appointments are between 11am and 12 noon do not too bad. I saw the doctor in charge of radiotherapy today after my treatment. She was very pleased with how my skin is reacting, not very pink at all at the moment, and she said all seemed well. I haven't had any pain this week so she was also pleased about that. She has discharged me from her care and so I will be back under the oncologist surgeon. I have an appointment when I finish treatment, next Thursday, with a nurse so she seemingly will go through anything else I will need to know. Only 4 to go so on the last stretch now. It has gone quickly and slowly at the same time. Have a good weekend everyone. It will be nice to have 2 days off. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: All done and dusted. I felt very emotional and a bit weepy. I wanted to feel elated but just had this feeling of being on my own now and please god let them have got it all. I saw the nurse after my treatment and she had been diagnosed with breast cancer a few years ago so reassured me that my feelings were perfectly normal. She put on a special cool patch over my nipple to help with the burning sensation, it warms up but then you just put it back it in packet and it cools down again So you can reuse it as many times as you want. She also gave me some strips to put under my boob as that is the main area likely to get irritated. Stops the rubbing etc. these are special things for after radiotherapy. Did you get these Margy? We had lunch at the hospital as we decided to go looking for new poles for the new curtains we ordered yesterday. We are going out tonight with four friends to celebrate the end of treatment for me. The sister of one of the men is just waiting for her husband to die, cancer, so also sad for them. Hubby has just come in this patch is called Actiform cool, the strips are called Mepilex Transfer. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: i had my first session of RT yesterday. They were running late, about 1hr, which didn't help the nerves! We had the chat with the nurse and she was very kind and tried to reassure me and answer all my questions. She explained what would happen in the treatment room and gave me Acqueous cream to wash with. Nothing to leave on my skin but I suppose they will give that if and when I need it. I shut my eyes when the machine was going over me so didn't really see where it went. I will be braver next time and keep the open! The worst bit was the positioning of me, and it was a man, so I shut my eyes again!  It is nice to have a couple of days off before I have to go every day next week. All my times are late morning, early afternoon so that is good. Keeps away from peak times. The hospital is an hour away as it is. I did get some sharp shooting pains in my breast last evening. They only lasted seconds but did continue all night. I ended up taking a pain killer to try and get to sleep. Is this normal so soon?  Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Not so good but trying not to let it get to me. I have put this strip on but it just protects the area which I suppose is a plus. I am very very red and have a circular area that looks worse than the rest. I will get though, I suppose I was too lucky during treatment. Hope you are ok. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Nearly half way through do time is passing reasonably quickly. I am waiting for the pain to kick in but so far I am ok. I have got my prescription and it is Colecalciferol 400 unit/ calcium carbonate 1.25 chewable tablets. I have ordered them, on line, so it will be a few days before I can pick them up. None of that nasty tablet we were talking about last week. I gave made 2 batches of scones this afternoon. One lot with strawberry pieces and the other batch with sultanas. We had to have a taste to make sure they were up to scratch!! I am going to be so fat by the time I have finished all this as I am eating everything and anything and normally I am very, very careful. Hope everyone else has hot on ok today. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I had the scan 3 weeks ago and I got a letter through the post telling me my results on Saturday. My GP got one at the same time as the letter said they would put these calcium tablets on repeat prescription for me. I went on line today and they were listed there so I just ordered them and will pick them up at the chemist in a couple of days. I also have an appointment with my surgeon in October to check up how things are. Seemingly that is 6 months after the operation. Different authorities seem to do things differently and at different times. I think I am quite lucky when I read other posts as I have never seen a junior doctor always the breast surgeon who is also a consultant. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Three to go so nearly at the end. I have those sharp shooting pains again today so I hope they don't get too bad. My machine was running very late today so they transferred me to another one. Different people but the same treatment. In fact there was 2 men today plus a lady. I was told my skin looked really good so keep doing whatever I was. I only put the Acqueous cream on at bedtime and wash with it in the morning. I have very pale, sensitive skin so it is doing fine. Only really slightly pink around my scar and nipple. I have made a fruit cake today so smelling nice in here. I am just making a bake well tart and then that's it. Other people have offered so I have said yes, normally I don't!  I have bought some meringues and small pastry cases, M&S, that I will fill with cream and strawberries on the day.  Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Good luck with today, last one, where did those 3 weeks go. Enjoy your cake and wine tonight, you deserve it. I have 2 to go so nearly there. Hubby and I are going out for lunch afterwards to celebrate, my appointment is 11.36 and then I am seeing the nurse at 11.50 am. What a shame you have had to wait all day for the end to be there. My skin is fine, so far, slightly pinker than the other boob but only if you look closely. Nipple/scar area is pink and sometimes sore but nothing I cannot put up with. I just hope I can try and put all this to one side and get back to a normal life, whatever that may be. I have made a lemon bake well tart today for my fundraising. Enjoy your evening. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: just back from hospital, last one tomorrow. I have an appointment with the nurse after my treatment, skin care I presume! I am getting red underneath my boob so was told to not wear a bra as often as possible. I have quite big boobs so that is easier said than done as it makes me ache. I do feel a little tired today so might not be doing much this afternoon, and I am getting sharp shooting pains again. Hope you are enjoying your first free day Margy, don't feel like you have forgotten to do something? Glad that cake and wine went down well. I think we are going out for lunch tomorrow to celebrate the last session. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: First day not rushing off to the hospital.feel ok today, no pain at moment. I am still tucked up in bed! There are 4 strange men downstairs fitting new  lounge/dining room carpet, new vinyl in kitchen and wooden flooring in hall. Lots of banging, drills going etc so I think I am safest in bed! Hubby is downstairs to make cups of tea! The cooling pad is great, get one if you can. Do others have to pay for gel, aqueous cream etc? I have been given everything free. I came home with 3 tubes of cream yesterday to make sure I had enough over the coming weeks. Lovely meal last night with friends. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Spoke too soon. Last night my skin erupted. I am so red from my nipple right under my boob and even on the skin below. At one point I have a round area that looks almost inflamed. Quite sore and painful. I have put on the strip the hospital gave me that is supposed to heal whilst letting the skin breathe. I hope it doesn't last too long. I managed my 3 mile walk this morning so trying to keep my bones well oiled ( and trying not to put too much weight on with eating all these left over cakes!) hubby and his brother are still banging upstairs but there are some tiles on now do I can see what they are looking like. Ironing now until I get sick of it or too tired, either will do!!  Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Nearly catching you up now! I am very funny with pain killers, cannot take anything paracetamol or codeine based so I just take an ibopufen. After the op I had tramadol but don't want to go there again if I can avoid it. I got an appointment today so see the head of radiotherapy but we are away on holiday so her secretary is trying to sort it out for me. If I had known there would be a follow up appointment we wouldn't have booked but we are away for a month( South of France, we have a caravan there). Hope your redness has calmed down a bit after your day off! Love joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I mentioned the pain today and they said if it gets too bad they would refer me to a doctor at the hospital. I must admit though it is not as painful today as it was yesterday, it still hurts mind you. Third over today so to celebrate we went retail shopping. Hubby got a couple of pairs of shoes so he couldn't complain too much!  Hope you had a good day. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I have been told to not use anything except the Acqueous cream. Different hospitals. There are 12 machines in St James at Leeds, 10 always in operation and the other 2 being serviced. I asked how many patients they saw in a day and was told 51. That is a lot of people with cancer in one area. I too am on Anastrozole for 5 years. I had a few symptoms initially but most of the time fine. I hope you don't have to wait long tomorrow. I will be pleased to gave a couple of days off. Enjoy your weekend. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Two days off and what a difference. I just have a bit of a dull ache but nothing like the pain I had last week. It goes to prove that it is the rads that is causing all my pain so in a way that is comforting. I have decided, for better or worse, that I am going to hold a fundraising garden party. I got an email from Breast Cancer Care talking about a strawberry tea party. I have had loads of information from them and it has all been very useful so I decided to raise some money for them. I have invited over 50 people so in a way I hope they don't all come! Today I have made 50 raspberry cup cakes, they are in the freezer. My sister is making a carrot cake and a friend a gingerbread. I am going to try and make something everyday while I am feeling ok. Gluten for punishment but I would like to think women in the future will be able to access what I have been able to. Day 7 tomorrow so nearly half way through. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Forgot to mention I got the results of my bone scan on Saturday. My bones are thinner than average so I am waiting for a prescription for another tablet, calcium based I presume. I will be rattling soon! Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Not feeling so good today. I have headache, bones ache, feel very lethargic and my boob is starting to hurt again. No baking today, I think, I am just sitting and vegetating. I might catch up on Master Chef unless I fall asleep of course. I am half way through my treatment now so that is a plus. Hope everyone feels better than me today. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I am 65 in November but I still think I am in my 30' s. Mind you I wouldn't be able to hand the kids back as they would have been ours and not our grandchildren. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Kathy, if I have worked my sims out right today us your last day. Hope you feel ok and you will soon get used to life without going to the hospital every day and displaying your boob!  surprisingly I am still fine. I went for my 3 mile walk this morning while hubby went to play golf. That was a bit of normality for him as he hasn't played since all this hit the fan in April. I am trying to get things sorted for my tea party but only doing a bit each day. Our son and daughter in law are staying Friday and Saturday night so it is bedrooms and bathroom to organise too. They are expecting their first child in November so has been a nice focus for me during all this. Take care and I hope you are not too pink and sore. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: H Kathy, hope you are enjoying that bubbly. Doesn't matter if you drink too much you don't have anything to do tomorrow. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: hi lovely ladies, what have you all been up to today with no hospitals to visit? I went back to weight watchers this morning. I only have about 7lbs to get to my goal but can I do it? Anyway I lost 1/2lb since I last went in February. So considering I have eaten what I fancied over the last few months I take that as a result! I have an awful headache today that won't go away. I cannot take paracetamol so usually just use that 4 head that you rub on your forehead. Not working today. The rest of me is ok still, I am hardly pink at all, nipple just hurts. Going for my 3 mile walk now as the rain has just stopped. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: hi Kathy and Margy, i  had a phone call from my breast care nurse today. She said she was ringing to see how I was after I had finished the radiotherapy and was there anything I needed! It was a nice surprise to think I am still on someone's radar and not totally abandoned. She asked about my skin, pains etc. I seemed to me ok during the day but the shooting pains start during the evening and slowly get worse then I am ok again. If this is the worst it gets I can cope so I have my fingers crossed. I do get tired but today I have done the supermarket shopping and been baking for 3 hours this afternoon so I deserve to be a little tired. Our son and wife are coming to stay tonight and tomorrow night, her folks are also staying tomorrow night( going to a wedding near us) the strawberry tea party on Sunday(about 30people coming) and then hubbies brother is staying the following few days as he is going to help hubby with the en suite. So they will be very busy, I will keep out of the way and occupy myself! Have a lovely weekend ladies and I will let you know how much money I raise next week. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Thank you, I am feeling pretty tired tonight. Decorating cakes, making strawberry tarts, blowing up balloons etc, etc. hubby has been busy too mind you sorting garden out. I just hope it stays fine as it has been horrendous today. I already have £130 in donations from people who cannot come so that  is a  good start. Speak to you on monday. Love Joyce xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Just had my second treatment this morning and there was a different man! Why are they all so young and good looking? I too have only seen ladies as my oncologist/ surgeon is a lady and the head of radiology is a lady too. My son said they would see a pair every 15 minutes. I said not my pair though! I asked about cream and the nurse said no. I could use a little of the Acqueous cream if I wanted to as it is very dry around my scar area. I have got a lot of sharp, shooting pains but she said this was normal as it was the nerve endings reacting and the good cells trying to recover. I am a little itchy under my arm so I think I will stop using the Dove deodorant they said I could use in case I am reacting to that.  No redness or burning yet so fingers crossed. At least my appointments are between 11am and 1.30 pm so we can miss the peak traffic as the hospital us in Leeds about 45 minutes away. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Kathy, It is very easy for us to say not to worry but it this unknown syndrome again but honestly really try not to worry. You don't feel anything and the machine doesn't go anywhere near your skin. The most uncomfortable thing is having to put your arm up in that unnatural position but it is exactly the same as your assessment appointment. They put a pen mark on my tattoos do they can see them more clearly to line the machine up but that is the only contact you will have. Good luck for Thursday. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Awful pain last night. I took an ibopufen  before I went to bed and was taking another one at 3.30am this morning. I told the radiologists before my treatment this morning. They immediately made me an appointment to see a nurse after my treatment was over. I had to wait about 30minutes but then I was called in. She had a little chat with me but then asked me to wait as the doctor in charge of the radiotherapy team had a clinic. A few minutes later I was in her room. She examined me and said everything seemed fine, no signs of anything nasty going on. She said it was unusual to have this amount of pain but I was very bruised and swollen after my operation so my boob was saying enough. She told me to take painkillers regularly for the next week and she would see me again next Friday to make sure everything was fine. I am in still in pain but at least I know it is just pain and no underlying things going on. At least I have 2 days off now so hopefully it will give my boob a chance to relax. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Kathy. Not the best way to spend your birthday being zapped. I am 64 years old so probably am that old git saying oh me back,hip, knee etc. I think I probably do already. A good Yorkshire lass so always some thing to moan about!!
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: And so say all of us. Just going to the hospital. Number 10 today, 5 to go after today. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I thought I had posted earlier but it doesn't seem to be here so here goes again. Well number 10 down and 5 to go. This time next week I will have finished, that is a good feeling. I was all finished in about 30 minutes today so that was good. I feel ok and still haven't any cooking of the skin. I am slightly pinker but nothing significant. I see the head of radiotherapy tomorrow after my treatment just to see how my pain is going and how I am coping. I have been fine this week. I have made a Victorian sponge and a boiled fruit cake today for the fundraising. I have also picked raspberries and gooseberries. That is a daily task at the moment. Hubby has wallpapered the dining room and it looks really nice. We are getting new furniture and carpet next week. We have got rid of the dark oak furniture and are getting a little more modern with light oak. Hope everyone has had a good day. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Margy, brilliant news that you have good strong bones. That's why we go away a lot to get plentry of vitamin D, that's my excuse and I am sticking to it!! The carpet, vinyl and wooden floor all look fantastic. We are both really pleased. Furniture tomorrow and then getting everything back into a home instead of behind piled up on the patio table. Have a fantastic weekend ladies and Kathy this time next week it will be a thing of the past for you too. Love Joyce.
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Oh my goodness, what a day you gave had. I have never heard of the big knicker syndrome, it sounds awful. I think I am reacting to all these zaps very well. My skin is just a little darker, abit sore around the nipple but nothing really. Hope you can get some sleep tonight and good luck tomorrow. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: What a fantastic time we had yesterday. Weather stRted awful but brightened up around lunchtime and by 2pm the sun was actually trying to make an appearance. All the cakes etc looked lively. I know I had made most of them but it her people were very kind and brought cakes as well. There were about 40 people here so that was a good turn out. It was lovely as our son and wife, who we hadn't seen in months and most people hadn't seen since the wedding last year, we're here too. I cannot believe how much money we raised £400 and some people who couldn't attend are making a donation on line so it will be even more. I am pretty tired today so the kitchen is now back to its original state so the rest of the day is relaxing. Hubby and his brother are busy distantmantalling the en suite so I am definitely keeping out of the way.  Skin still fine but pains are still there but I can cope with that. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Session number 3 over only 12 to go! Am I counting?  YES is the answer!  Another different man today. The machine I normally go on was being serviced so I went on a different one. They were absolutely on time so not long to wait. I said to hubby as we were going I was getting a bit  blase  about it all now so wasn't concerned at all. I am getting quite a lot if pain in my breast but no redness or soreness yet. I have signed up to hold a strawberry tea party for breast cancer in August. I hope I can handle it as I would like to do it. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: How did you get on today? I have been thinking about you. Hope it all went well and you are now a bit more relaxed about it all. I am a third of the way through now and it has gone reasonably quickly. We try to do something in the afternoon so the day isn't all about hospital and radiotherapy. Hope to hear from you soon. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: 9 down and 6 to go so feel as if I am on the home stretch. I like to say I finish my treatment next Thursday, it. Doesn't sound too far away! I had an awful night. The lethargy got better as the e end g went on but as soon as my head hit the pillow I was wide awake. At 3.30am I closed my book and tried to go to sleep. I must have fallen asleep as hubby woke me up at 9.30am to get breakfast and take my Anastrozole, I take it at 10am every day. My appointment wasn't until 01.12pm today so plenty of time. I do feel better today, no tiredness, headache or feeling sick. Still have joint ache but I have a dodgy shoulder and knee do that is nothing new!  After the hospital we went looking for baby things as our youngest son and his wife are expecting their first child in November. Cheered me up no end. We know it is a boy and seeing as we already have 2 beautiful granddaughters, 3 & 6, it will be lovely to gave a boy. They live in St Albans so we don't see them very often but they are coming up the weekend of the 2nd to help with the fundraising. Hope everyone else is doing good today. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Kathy, hope number 13 hasn't left any nasty side effects, only 2 more to go. Today has really been the first day of thinking 'I don't have to go to the hospital today', Friday was manic with the new carpets etc. I  still feel ok, a bit sore but nothing too bad. Have a nice evening. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I agree fully. Reading some of the other posts about ladies who have or are going through hell I do feel grateful that my journey is all but over and, hopefully, I will have a full life with many more years. I don't feel grateful I had breast cancer but even my own case could have been so much worse if they hadn't done that biopsy. Under my arm feels ok it is just my boob. I do still get shooting pains but they are not as frequent or as bad. We will all be better soon. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I was told I was grade 2 after the biopsy but it was increased to grade 3 after my lumpectomy. I was told I was a hairs breathe away from chemo, grade 3 are usually automatic chemo, but because my lymph nodes were clear I have just finished radiotherapy. So not all grade 3 will have chemo do you might be lucky as I was. Good luck. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Content: Good luck to Snowys mum and Helen. As Kathy said 3 of us were here for each other and it truly did help me. I was shit scared waiting for the op. They had to give me Valium to calm me down!! BUT here I am and the other end. I won't lie and say it has been easy but it does get easier. I think it is being told you have cancer. I kept saying that to myself and it just didn't ring true, they were talking about someone els. When I said to someone why me, they said why not you? Made me think. Why did I think I was specialn and couldn't get a load of crap thrown at me. This is one of the worse times, waiting. The next one will be waiting for the results after your op. Then it is a mad house and you just have to go with whatever they throw at you and you will cope. My daughter in maws mum, she is a nurse, gave me a product called Rescue. You can buy it in most chemists and some supermarkets. Put 4 drops on your tongue before a stressful time and it takes the edge off and calms you a bit. All natural ingredients, give it a go. Good luck to you both and keep posting and we will keep answering and supporting. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Content: You are certainly not alone with these anxieties and thoughts. I was told my lump was 99% a fatty tissue but took a biopsie as I was going away for 6 weeks. Went for the results and out of the blue told it was cancerous. My advice, make sure you have someone with you, you cannot go in there on your own. If, and I say IF, it is bad news you will be given the best possible treatment and everything will happen quickly. Breast cancer is very treatable,not a nice journey, but you will be fine. I have just had my yearly all clear and still find it hard to believe this time last year was cr.p! Good luck.
Posts.Title: Coping With the Waiting !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Congratulations. I have just finished treatment yesterday so trying to get my head around not having to go to hospital again until check up in October. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: its official

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with stage 2 cancer in April this year. After the operation it was regraded to a stage 3 as the lump was bigger and there were a lot of cancerous cells in the surrounding tissue. They took out the sentinel node but this was clear so no spread. I am starting radiotherapy this Friday and was told by the oncologist that as it hadn't spread chemo would be unnecessary even though stage 3 is usually automatically chemo. She told me out of 100 women in my situation 98 percent of people given chemo would be over treated. I would really ask lots of questions. Is it a post code lottery? I am 64 years old so older but your cancer is a lesser grade and hadn't spread. Doesn't make too much sense does it? Good luck.
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: Forgot to mention I have been in a lot of pain in my breast 2 weeks after operation. The hole got so hard, fills up with blood, I was told. It is a lot better now but it has taken 9 weeks. Gentle massage helped a bit and I also took a pain killer at night to help me sleep.
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: We are in the South if France for the next 4,weeks. We normally drive but not knowing how I would be we flew..mas I went under the scanner, it didn't beep so I kept on walking. I was then asked to go back through and wait. I was then directed through the scanner where you have to raise your arms for 3,seconds. The lady then started to friske me so I politely asked her to be gentle with my right breast as I had just had surgery for breast cancer.. Have you had any treatment, she aske, so I told her radiotherapy. Oh that explains it, she said, have a look at your image. all over my right boob was a bigger yellow blob. That is the radiation she said and it set our machines off! I just looked at my image with my mouth open. How long does it stay in your system? And no wonder I am still getting sharp pains. I suppose it is still killing the little buggers even after 6 weeks of finishing RADS. It is quite hot here so sitting here, in the shade, with my factor 50'on. I am really trying to pace myself as my legs are constantly throbbing and I am getting tired quite quickly. Love joyce.
Posts.Title: Never expected this!!

Posts.Content: I have just been given the all clear today, one year on. I have had several meltdowns along the way, before surgery, after surgery, after treatment had finished etc. I got myself in a real state the anniversary of the diagnosis but celebrated the anniversary of my surgery. Take one step at a time. Once you are on the treadmill time will fly by. Accept all the help and support you can, listen to your body and don't try to do too much too soon. Good luck, this time next year you will be where I am. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: How are you all so brave, I've just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Sorry you had to join this club. But it is a great support. I was diagnosed with stage 1 grade 2 invasive cancer in April this year. After my lumpectomy and sentinel node removal ( they only took the main one) at my result day , 3  agonising week wait,  my cancer was regarded to a 3 , aggressive. I don't know if it is a post code lottery but I was told chemo would be over treatment in my case. All the books say grade 3 is automatic chemo! Anyhow I had 15 sessions of radiotherapy and am just getting over the effects of that. Mine were bad but other ladies not so severe. I was scared shitless, pardon my French, but all not as bad as the waiting and the thoughts that go through your head. You are not going to die and you will come through this. Keep strong and sorry your hubby is also having a rough time. Love Joyce  p.s. Go on Breastcancercare.com and you can order, free, leaflets on anything you need to know about. They are very informative which is what I wanted.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed yesterday...

Posts.Content: sorry I meant lumpectomy not whatever I typed before! Senior moment!! Mine felt really hard but it was blood. I have just had RADS and was told I had to leave it after my assessment visit as that was what the radiotherapy was worked out on so my shape couldn't change. It has lessened but still feels quite hard. I was lucky and just missed out on chemo. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: A question for my friends

Posts.Content: Did you have a lymphectomy? After mine in April I had a really hard lump above the scar where they had taken out the cancerous cells. I was told the ' hole' left when they took out the lump fills up with blood until the tissue starts to heal. This felt harder and lumpier( word?) than the original lump. It has now settled down and feels more normal but still quite hard. Hope this helps but if it gets too painful get it checked out as I do know someone who had to have this drained. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: A question for my friends

Posts.Content: I am having acupuncture for the hot sweats. Ask at your local hospital, mine are free. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: tamoxifen and cod liver oil

Posts.Content: I have just looked at my path report.  It says stage T1, G3 Infiltrating/Invasive  Ductal  Carcinoma, tumour size 13 mm. I know I was border line for chemo but as my lymph nodes were clear RADS would be suitable as a prevention. I thank the Lord. reading what some of you ladies went,are going through, I have been so lucky. Good luck to all. Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Grade 2

Posts.Content: Mine is grade 3. I get really confused also as I had a lumpectomy and have just finished RADS, yesterday. Other people with lower grade cancer have had mastectomies and chemo. I am certainly grateful but is it a post code lottery as to what surgery and treatment is on offer? My surgeon said they get as good as results from removing the lump as removing the breast. So why are women having to go through this radical treatment. Is this over treatment? Love Joyce
Posts.Title: Grade 2
